text: I was trying to acess the <http://api.pmo.gov.et/v1/patients|api.pmo.gov.et/v1/patients> api and I'm getting CORS blocked Error.  Currently, I'm bypassing it with proxy. I thought this kind of api was supposed to be fully public and has to allow all origins. Any suggestions ?

root.text:
I am currently working on EthCovid19Track App for Android, and anyone who is behind this Case Api Endpoints <https://api.pmo.gov.et/v1/cases/> can you guys add the following parameters also, it will be helpful. Thanks for exposing the API to public and third-party app developers.
Days Since Start, Total Cases, Deaths, Recovered, Active Cases, Region.

• Days Since Start - show the number of days between the first report of a case of coronavirus in that region and today.
• Total Cases - show the number of confirmed cases from the first report till now at the national level
• Deaths - show the number of deceased at the national level
• Recovered - show the number of recoveries at the national level
• Active Cases - show the number of cases (Total - Recovered) at the national level
• Region - show the affected region/state so far, the number of cases at the region/state level and the location information.
```[
	{
		"start": 1583971200,
		"total": 23,
		"stable": 18,
		"critical": 1,
		"recovered": 3,
		"deceased": 0,
		"regions": [
			{
				"region": "Addis Ababa",
				"coordinates": [9.005401, 38.763611],
				"total": 18
			},
			{
				"region": "Oromiya",
				"coordinates": [8.514477, 39.269257],
				"total": 5
			}
		]
	}```

text: <@U0107JERE9L>

Hi folks. 


A friend shared a resource I wanted to pass along in case it’s of any interest to folks. An app just launched called "I-report Covid", which is a self report tool for people to fill out around the world! It uses blockchain technology and will become an open database for anyone to use in real time and study this pandemic going forward. The goal is to help build an open global database to fight COVID-19! The team is beginning to translate the tool into multiple languages and Is interested in collaborating with anyone and everyone if it is of use. 
<https://ireport-covid.app/|https://ireport-covid.app/>
#ireportcovid

attachments.title: COVID-19 Worldwide Survey - IReport-Covid App
attachments.text: Short anonymous survey - open to all, powered by Algorand blockchain

elements.text: Hi folks.

A friend shared a resource I wanted to pass along in case it’s of any interest to folks. An app just launched called "I-report Covid", which is a self report tool for people to fill out around the world! It uses blockchain technology and will become an open database for anyone to use in real time and study this pandemic going forward. The goal is to help build an open global database to fight COVID-19! The team is beginning to translate the tool into multiple languages and Is interested in collaborating with anyone and everyone if it is of use.
https://ireport-covid.app/
#ireportcovid

text: To organisations and individuals working at the forefront of fighting COVID19 in Ethiopia, please share with us if you have any data analysis, visualisation and modelling problems/challenges relevant to your effort. At the moment I and <@U011FFEFB2L> are working on estimating high risk groups using data from <http://www9.who.int/gho/en/|WHO>, <https://data.humdata.org/dataset|HDX>, and  <https://github.com/CSSEGISandData/COVID-19/tree/master/csse_covid_19_data|covid19 cases> data.  It would be ideal if we can focus our energy in producing results that is relevant to your decision making

attachments.title: Global Health Observatory (GHO) data
attachments.text: The Global Health Observatory is WHO's gateway to health-related statistics for more than 1000 indicators for its 194 Member States. Data are organized to monitor progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), including health status indicators to monitor progress towards for the overall health goal, indicators to track equity in health indicators, and the indicators for the specific health and health-related targets of the SDGs.
attachments.fallback: World Health Organization: Global Health Observatory (GHO) data

attachments.title: Search for a Dataset - Humanitarian Data Exchange
attachments.fallback: Search for a Dataset - Humanitarian Data Exchange

text:
<!here> ask for help! 

Can we please have a doctor / epidemiologist review the content we’ve put together for the <http://COVID19.et|COVID19.et> website landing page? 

This is the site that our tv/radio/digital ads will direct people to. We need your review today in English before we can get it to translated to Ethiopian languages. Content: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qLluLfCydMnTBeQ3rRbh4Xp-ne1hXJ34rChLlmolqYg|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qLluLfCydMnTBeQ3rRbh4Xp-ne1hXJ34rChLlmolqYg> please feel free to edit directly in the doc using “suggesting” mode. And comment me in with any general feedback / questions.

text: <@U0107AYF16H> I made these suggestions before looking at the design mock up page. So, maybe some of the frequently asked questions I’m suggesting can be integrated since the landing page design has a ‘question-answer’ format.

elements.text: I made these suggestions before looking at the design mock up page. So, maybe some of the frequently asked questions I’m suggesting can be integrated since the landing page design has a ‘question-answer’ format.

text:
Hi, the landing page is quite well done. A few suggestions just to make sure we actually have people reading/not flipping through. 
We should add two sections (adopted from ECDC and Canadian public health agency)
A. Frequently asked questions 
- what is COVID-19? (A sentence is enough since it’s clearly explained in the first part of the page)
- where does COVID-19/coronaviruses come from (I have received SO many questions about this)
- How is the COVID-19 compared to seasonal flu? 
- How severe is COVID-19 infection? 
- What is the best way of protecting myself and my family from COVID-19?
- Are children also at risk of infection? What is their potential role in transmission? 
- What do I do if I am feeling anxious or stressed because of events related to COVID-19? 
Of course, more questions can be added. I realize some of the questions are already explained in the text, but we should provide a condensed text for these questions in this section. 

B. List of resources for reliable news/updates/ questions/emergency etc... I see Section 4 says resources, but I’m not sure if these are included.

elements.text:
Hi, the landing page is quite well done. A few suggestions just to make sure we actually have people reading/not flipping through. 
We should add two sections (adopted from ECDC and Canadian public health agency)
A. Frequently asked questions 
- what is COVID-19? (A sentence is enough since it’s clearly explained in the first part of the page)
- where does COVID-19/coronaviruses come from (I have received SO many questions about this)
- How is the COVID-19 compared to seasonal flu? 
- How severe is COVID-19 infection? 
- What is the best way of protecting myself and my family from COVID-19?
- Are children also at risk of infection? What is their potential role in transmission? 
- What do I do if I am feeling anxious or stressed because of events related to COVID-19? 
Of course, more questions can be added. I realize some of the questions are already explained in the text, but we should provide a condensed text for these questions in this section. 

B. List of resources for reliable news/updates/ questions/emergency etc... I see Section 4 says resources, but I’m not sure if these are included.

text: Happy to integrate the new questions. Do you have feedback on the answers in our doc

text: Feedback on the answers you have already provided on the doc? All looks good. Or do you want me to provide answers to the new questions that I suggested?

text: Actually both would be great :pray::skin-tone-5:

Definetly worth looking into what this group has been doing might be worth talking to them about their experiance they also have been doing weekly radio shows answering questions live amazing group. They also have translated the page in different local languages.
